articles.title: Kim Jong Il Enjoys Performance Given by Chinese Art Group
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Enjoys Performance Given by Chinese Art Group
						
 Pyongyang, July 15 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, Friday enjoyed a performance given by an art group of dance drama "Confetti on Silk Road" of the Gansu Provincial Song and Dance Theatre of China. It is visiting the DPRK on the 50th anniversary of the DPRK-China treaty of friendship, cooperation and mutual assistance and the 30th anniversary of its performance in the DPRK.
					 The head of the art group presented to Kim Jong Il a gift prepared with sincerity on behalf of the art group.
					
					 The dance drama is based on a mural painting in Gansu Province in the northwestern part of China. Dealing with the story about the life of the Chinese people and peoples of foreign countries on silk road during the Tang Dynasty of China the dance drama reflects the aspiration and wishes of the people who value good faith and sense of obligation, opposed to the corrupt feudal ruling quarters in those days and all social evils caused by them.
					
					 The performance was acclaimed by the audience for high artistic skill of the performers as it presented dynamic plastic dances to the tune of cheerful melodies.
					
					 After the performance was over, Kim Jong Il met the leading members of the art group and congratulated them on their successful performance.
					
					 Among the audience were Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the WPK, Kim Yong Chun, member of the Political Bureau of the WPK Central Committee and minister of the People's Armed Forces, Kim Ki Nam and Choe Thae Bok, members of the Political Bureau and secretaries of the WPK Central Committee, Kang Sok Ju, member of the Political Bureau of the WPK Central Committee and vice-premier of the Cabinet, Jang Song Thaek, alternate member of the Political Bureau of the WPK Central Committee and vice-chairman of the NDC, Kim Yang Gon, Choe Ryong Hae and Thae Jong Su, alternate members of the Political Bureau and secretaries of the WPK Central Committee, Kim Jong Gak, alternate member of the Political Bureau of the WPK Central Committee and first vice department director of the General Political Bureau of the Korean People's Army, Mun Kyong Dok, alternate member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the WPK Central Committee and chief secretary of the Pyongyang City Committee of the WPK, Ri Myong Su, minister of People's Security, Kim Kye Gwan, first vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Hyon Chol Hae, department director of the NDC, and officials of party and armed forces organs, culture and arts and media.
					
					 Also among the audience were head of the art group Zhang Ming, vice-director of the Cultural Department of Gansu Province, Liu Hongcai, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK, and his embassy officials and Chinese guests staying in the DPRK.

articles.title: Sino-DPRK Friendship Will Be Everlasting: Head of Chinese Delegation
articles.content:
Sino-DPRK Friendship Will Be Everlasting: Head of Chinese Delegation
						
 Pyongyang, July 15 (KCNA) -- The Sino-DPRK friendship will be everlasting, Wu Donghe, chairman of the China-Korea Friendship Association, told KCNA on Thursday.
					 Wu is heading the delegation of the Chinese People's Association for Friendship with Foreign Countries and the China-Korea Friendship Association on a visit to the DPRK.
					
					 The delegation has deeply felt the bilateral friendship from the moment it arrived in the DPRK, he said, adding:
					
					 The bilateral friendship was provided by President Kim Il Sung and Chairman Mao Zedong and other Chinese leaders of elder generation.
					
					 This friendship is valuable legacy and asset handed down by the leaders of elder generation of the two countries.
					
					 The China-DPRK relations of friendship and cooperation deeply rooted in the hearts of the two countries are vigorously developing in all domains.
					
					 General Secretary Kim Jong Il visited China several times and shared in-depth views on the development of the bilateral relations and matters of mutual concern and reached important agreements with General Secretary Hu Jintao.
					
					 His China visits are of weighty significance in developing the traditional Sino-DPRK friendship onto a new higher stage.
					
					 Commemorations of the 50th anniversary of the China-DPRK treaty of friendship, cooperation and mutual assistance took place successfully and exchange of high-level delegations are brisk between the two countries.
					
					 This is a testimony to the fact that the two countries attach importance to the bilateral relations of friendship.
					
					 Touring different places of the DPRK during its stay, the delegation witnessed the indomitable and diligent Korean people working hard to significantly greet 2012, the centenary of birth of Kim Il Sung.
					
					 We wish the Korean people greater progress under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 We will contribute to further promoting the development of the Sino-DPRK friendly relations and deepening friendship between the two peoples through diverse cooperation and exchanges.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Chinese Delegation
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Chinese Delegation
						
 Pyongyang, July 15 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a friendly talk with the delegation of the Chinese People's Association for Friendship with Foreign Countries and the China-Korea Friendship Association led by Wu Donghe, chairman of the China-Korea Friendship Association, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Friday.
					 Wu Donghe said leader Kim Jong Il's several visits to China were of weighty significance in developing the traditional China-DPRK friendship onto a new higher stage.
					
					 The delegation was deeply moved to witness the achievements made by the diligent and brave Korean people in various fields, he said.
					
					 He hoped that under the leadership of Kim Jong Il they would build a thriving nation in 2012 marking the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 He expressed the will to contribute to strengthening the bilateral friendly relations in conformity with the intention of top leaders of the two countries.

articles.title: Anniversary of DPRK-China Treaty Marked in Shenyang of China
articles.content:
Anniversary of DPRK-China Treaty Marked in Shenyang of China
 Pyongyang, July 15 (KCNA) -- The Liaoning Branch of the China-Korea Friendship Association gave a reception in Shenyang of China on July 11 to mark the 50th anniversary of the DPRK-China treaty of friendship, cooperation and mutual assistance.
					 Present there on invitation were the DPRK consul general and consuls in Shenyang.
					
					 On hand were the vice-governor of the Liaoning Provincial People's Government, the deputy chief of the Staff of the Liaoning Provincial Military Area of the Chinese People's Liberation Army, the deputy director of the Foreign Affairs Committee of the Liaoning Provincial People's Congress, the deputy director of the Liaoning Provincial Security Department and other officials concerned.
					
					 Speeches were made at the reception.

articles.title: Friendship Meeting Held at DPRK Embassy in Moscow
articles.content:
Friendship Meeting Held at DPRK Embassy in Moscow
						
 Pyongyang, July 15 (KCNA) -- A friendship meeting with staff members of the Chinese embassy took place at the DPRK embassy in Moscow on July 12 on the occasion of the 50th anniversary of the signing of the DPRK-China treaty of friendship, cooperation and mutual assistance.
					 Present there were DPRK Ambassador Kim Yong Jae and his embassy officials and Chinese Ambassador Li Hui and his embassy officials.
					
					The participants made a bow before the full-length painting of President Kim Il Sung standing with General Secretary Kim Jong Il and saw round photos displayed on the theme of "Great life devoted to the people" and "Education in DPRK".
					
					 Kim Yong Jae said in his speech at the meeting that over the half century since the signing of the treaty the two parties and the two governments have supported and closely cooperated with each other in various fields, powerfully demonstrating the tremendous vitality of the DPRK-China friendship before the whole world.
					
					 The traditional DPRK-China friendly relations are being successfully carried forward and developed on a new higher stage, he noted, expressing belief that the vitality of the DPRK-China friendship would be powerfully demonstrated once again this year.
					
					 Li Hui said the Chinese side would join the DPRK side in making positive efforts to put the friendly and cooperative relations onto a higher level by thoroughly implementing the agreements reached between the top leaders of the two countries.
					
					 He said China would join the DPRK side in making concerted efforts to boost the bilateral friendly relations and protect the fundamental interests of the two countries and peoples in the future, too.
					
					 Then it followed a reception and a joint art performance.

articles.title: Anniversary of Demise of Kim Il Sung Commemorated
articles.content:
Anniversary of Demise of Kim Il Sung Commemorated
						
 Pyongyang, July 15 (KCNA) -- Various events were held in many countries on the 17th anniversary of the demise of President Kim Il Sung from July 2 to 8. They included week of visits to Kimilsungia greenhouse in Guinea, seminars on Kim Il Sung's exploits in Italy and Bangladesh, briefing on his greatness in Indonesia, reading session in Uganda and remembrance meetings in Russia, Laos, Bangladesh and Bulgaria.
					 A department director of the Ministry of Mining Industry of Guinea hoped that the President would always live in the hearts of the Africans thanks to widespread dissemination of immortal flower Kimilsungia across the African continent including Guinea. 
					
					 The general secretary of the Central Committee of the Unified Communist Party of Italy and the chief of Firenze Group of the Committee for the Study of the Juche idea said the President has been boundlessly revered by progressive mankind for the immortal exploits performed for the Korean revolution and the world revolution.
					
					 The chairman of the Bangladesh Institute of the Juche Idea said the founding of the Juche idea marked a historical event which brought about a radical turn in the development of human thoughts and the struggle to carve out the destiny of the popular masses. Progressive mankind will always remember the exploits performed by the President for the cause of independence against imperialism, he added.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Praised by Foreign Political Figure
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Praised by Foreign Political Figure
						
 Pyongyang, July 15 (KCNA) -- Rosanita Campos, vice-president of the Party for Free Motherland of Brazil, contributed an article titled  "Kim Il Sung and the DPRK in the Past and Today" to the July 8 issue of the Brazilian newspaper Hora do Povo on the 17th anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The article said all the achievements in the DPRK would be unthinkable without the patriotic devotion of Kim Il Sung, adding he set up Kim Il Sung University after the liberation of the country and exerted all his efforts for its development. Under his leadership the campaign against illiteracy was successfully conducted in the DPRK and its people vigorously turned out in the building of a new country, the article noted, and continued: 
					
					 Kim Il Sung set forth the "10-Point Programme of the Great Unity of the Whole Nation for the Reunification of the Country" and exerted all his efforts to replace the Armistice Agreement with a peace agreement so as to achieve the independent and peaceful reunification of the country.

articles.title: Foreign Radios and TVs Air Programs on Kim Il Sung's Exploits
articles.content:
Foreign Radios and TVs Air Programs on Kim Il Sung's Exploits
 Pyongyang, July 15 (KCNA) -- Radio and TV broadcasting services of various countries aired programs on the exploits of President Kim Il Sung and showed DPRK films from July 7 and to 9 on the 17th anniversary of his demise.
					 The Cuban Reloj broadcasting service introduced his glorious revolutionary life several times.
					
					 The Singaporean TV broadcasting service aired a program about how wisely the President led the WPK, the state and people.
					
					The Ugandan State Radio Broadcasting Service said the revolutionary history of the President is still given steady continuity as General Secretary Kim Jong Il has creditably carried forward his ideas and cause.
					
					 The Guinean domestic radio broadcasting service stressed that the President would always be alive along with everlasting and prosperous socialist Korea.
					
					 The international radio and seven national languages channel aired the similar program.
					
					 The Lao National Radio aired the immortal revolutionary hymn "Song of General Kim Il Sung" and Lao National Television telecast a program introducing the April Spring Friendship Art Festival.
					
					 The Equatorial Guinean radio repeatedly aired a program on the noble internationalist sense of obligation of Kim Il Sung who rendered support, material and moral, to the African countries in their struggle for national independence and building of a new society.

articles.title: Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Work Marked
articles.content:
Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Work Marked 
						
Pyongyang, July 15 (KCNA) -- A meeting was held at the East Pyongyang Grand Theatre Friday to mark the 20th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's work "Theory of Musical Art."
					 The work, published on July 17, 1991, expounds the essence, mission, role, contents and style of the Juche-based music as well as the issues of rendition and training reserve artistes. It also sets forth the tasks and ways to do so.
					
					 Present there were Kim Pyong Hun, chairman of the Central Committee of the General Federation of the Unions of Art and Literature of Korea, officials, creators and artistes in the field of culture and art and teachers and researchers of art education institutions.
					
					 Ri Il Nam, chairman of the Central Committee of the Musicians Union of Korea, in a report said that the work serves as important guidelines to be always held fast to in building the Juche-based musical art.
					
					 Since the publication of the work the musical art in the DPRK has covered the shining path of development under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il for two decades, the reporter noted, and went on:
					
					 Big successes have been made in music of songs, instrumental music, opera art and other fields with the ideology and theory of the work as guidelines. All these achievements are the shining fruition of the energetic leadership of Kim Jong Il for the development of the Juche-based musical art.
					
					 The reporter called for thoroughly embodying the immortal idea and theory of Kim Jong Il to usher in a new heyday of musical art.

articles.title: Gold Craftwork "Peach of Longevity"
articles.content:
Gold Craftwork "Peach of Longevity"
						
 Pyongyang, July 15 (KCNA) -- A gold craftwork "Peach of Longevity" is on display at the International Friendship Exhibition House in the DPRK. It was a gift the manager of a trading corporation of Singapore sent to President Kim Il Sung in April Juche 81 (1992), wishing him good health.
					 With a long career as a businessperson, the manager had opportunities to get knowledge of the President's greatness and noble personality and entertained a feeling of deep reverence for him.
					
					 The feeling incited the manager to present a gift to him. So, the manager prepared the goldware with the help of skilled craftsmen.

articles.title: Campaign for Honor Student Prize Active in DPRK
articles.content:
Campaign for Honor Student Prize Active in DPRK
 Pyongyang, July 15 (KCNA) -- A campaign for July 15 Honor Student Prize is on a high tide among secondary school students of the DPRK.
					 The government confers the prize on those who finish the school course with honors.
					
					 The campaign was launched in the country after a national meeting of honor students of secondary schools held in August Juche 79 (1990). 
					
					 Since the start of the campaign, there has been a big progress in the study of secondary school students.
					
					 Pyongyang Kansong Secondary School, Pyongyang Secondary School No. 1, Changdok School and East Pyongyang Secondary School No. 1 are taking the lead in the campaign.
					
					 In particular, Pyongyang Kansong Secondary School is well known for a large number of students honored with the prize.
					
					 A student of Pyongyang Pothonggang Secondary School, Kim Son Nam, told KCNA he would work hard in the remaining days of the school to win the prize without fail.
					
					 Korean students of secondary schools have proved successful at international contests, including the 50th International Mathematical Olympiad.

articles.title: Worthwhile Life under Care of Great Leader (12)
articles.content:
Worthwhile Life under Care of Great Leader (12)
						
 Pyongyang, July 15 (KCNA) -- The Yombun Revolutionary Historic Site on the seashore of Kyongsong County on the northern tip of the country is also associated with the giant footprints of General Kim Jong Il.
					 It was one day in November 1997 when Kim Jong Il visited the site and showed a warm loving care for Ri Yong Ae who was a lecturer at that time. It was a leg of his field guidance to follow in the footsteps of President Kim Il Sung who visited there. 
					
					 He learned about her family and made sure that she was known all over the country. To repay the loving care shown by the general she pledged to dedicate herself to the work for making undying feats of the peerlessly great men shine forever.
					
					Always remembering the glorious days when she had the honor of being received by the President and General Secretary Kim Jong Il and getting from them appreciations she hardly deserved, she has worked hard at her remote post rain or shine, always picturing the general to herself. She devoted her wisdom and energies to educating people through revolutionary relics.
					
					 Thanks to the general's deep political trust she is now working as an official of the North Hamgyong Provincial Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea after graduating from a party cadre training institution.

articles.title: DPRK Praised by S. Korean Inhabitant
articles.content:
DPRK Praised by S. Korean Inhabitant
 Pyongyang, July 15 (KCNA) -- A south Korean inhabitant posted on Internet many articles praising the northern half of Korea, a south Korean paper said.
					Since 2005 he has posted on "Properly understanding the DPRK", "Broad-billed roller for reunification" and other Internet homepages "With the Century", reminiscences of President Kim Il Sung, and more than 70,000 articles praising the greatness of the President and General Secretary Kim Jong Il and introducing the DPRK.

articles.title: Chinese Magazine on Ever-green Sino-DPRK Friendship
articles.content:
Chinese Magazine on Ever-green Sino-DPRK Friendship
 Pyongyang, July 15 (KCNA) -- The 28th issue of the Chinese magazine Liaowang carried an article contributed by Gao Haorong, former correspondent of the  Xinhua News Agency in Pyongyang, under the title of "Motive Force of 5 Decade-long Sino-DPRK Friendship and Cooperation."
					 July 11 is the day when China and the DPRK signed the treaty of friendship, cooperation and mutual assistance, the article noted, and continued:
					
					 Over the last half century the Sino-DPRK relations of friendship and cooperation have steadily grown stronger thanks to the concerted efforts of the two peoples, standing all tests and weather, and they are now blossoming and yielding fruits in various fields.
					
					 The most important characteristics of the Sino-DPRK friendship is Chinese and DPRK leaders' regular exchange of visits to deepen understanding.
					
					General Secretary Kim Jong Il visited China three times in a year from last May to May this year. This is something very rare in the history of bilateral relations, a clear proof of particular ties between China and the DPRK.
					
					 It referred in detail to the facts that the enlarged meeting of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea was convened in connection with his recent visit to China, celebrations of the 90th anniversary of the founding the Communist Party of China were held and exchange and cooperation got brisk between the two countries in various fields including economy, culture, education, science and technology.

articles.title: Company Famous for Its Sound Equipment
articles.content:
Company Famous for Its Sound Equipment 
						
Pyongyang, July 15 (KCNA) -- The Korea Meari Co., Ltd. situated in Thongil Street, Pyongyang is famous for sound facilities. It also functions as a scientific research centre. 
					 It is equipped with modern facilities capable of producing latest sound facilities and various other types of electronic goods.
					
					 Its predecessor was the research group for the development of microphones which was established late in the 1980s under the deep care of leader Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 New-type microphones produced by it were widely used at May Day Stadium and other theatres, cinema houses and cultural establishments during the period of the 13th World Youth and Students Festival. 
					
					 It was against this backdrop that the company was established on July 10 in 1991. 
					
					 A sincere contribution was made by Kim Kyu Sang, Korean resident in Japan, who is adviser to the Federation of Koreans in Commerce in Okayama Prefecture under the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan. 
					
					 Kim Jong Il highly praised him for his patriotic deed and saw to it that he was appointed as honorary manager of the company and a monument to his loyalty erected. 
					
					 Very popular are his products such as tens of thousands of microphones, megaphones, speakers, karaokes and fire warning instruments. 
					
					 Microphones, in particular, won gold medals at different exhibitions including the 22nd Geneva International Exhibition of Invention and New Technology and evoked lively response at exhibitions held in China and Japan. 
					
					 On July 12, the company marked its 20th anniversary with a meeting and other events.

articles.title: Revolutionary Opera "The Sea of Blood" Staged 1 600 Times for Four Decades
articles.content:
Revolutionary Opera "The Sea of Blood" Staged 1 600 Times for Four Decades
						
 Pyongyang, July 15 (KCNA) -- 40 years have passed since the premiere of the revolutionary opera "The Sea of Blood" was given in the DPRK. The opera has been staged 1 600 times. 
					 The opera was adapted from a revolutionary drama "The Sea of Blood", an immortal classic masterpiece created by President Kim Il Sung during the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle in the 1930s. The drama deals with the indiscriminate massacre of the Korean people by the Japanese imperialists. Its heroine gets gradually awakened and comes out to the road of the revolutionary struggle. 
					
					 Leader Kim Jong Il unfolded a far-reaching plan to bring about a turn in the field of opera through the adaptation of the drama to opera and energetically led the work. Therefore, Korean-style revolutionary opera "The Sea of Blood" was created in 1971 with the introduction of verse-songs, pangchang, dance, stage arts, orchestral music and others.
					
					 On its basis, the "The Sea of Blood"-style revolutionary operas "The Flower Girl", "A True Daughter of the Party" and "Tell O Forest" were created in a short span of time and became known to the world.

articles.title: More People Quit Smoking in DPRK
articles.content:
More People Quit Smoking in DPRK
 Pyongyang, July 15 (KCNA) -- An increasing number of people are quitting smoking in the DPRK.
					 The Tobacco Substitutes Exhibition in Pyongyang is always crowded with people. 
					
					Many people who want to quit smoking go to the exhibition to have consultations with doctors and purchase tobacco substitutes. 
					
					 The exhibition provides visitors with knowledge of tobacco's adverse effect on human body, families and society through videos and wall charts.
					
					 Among the goods on sale are no-tobacco pipes, nicotine filters, anti-smoking gum and pill. The pill won appreciation from the World Health Organization (WHO). 
					
					 A few days after beginning to take the pill, the user feels no pleasure in smoking but have a good appetite. It also helps get rid of coughing and sputum.
					
					 The goods are also available for passive smokers suffering from a respiratory trouble.
					
					 Some of the visitors have succeeded in stopping smoking.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Adherence to Ideology and Faith
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Adherence to Ideology and Faith
						
 Pyongyang, July 15 (KCNA) -- The cause of building a thriving nation in the DPRK is sure to be accomplished and the Korean revolution will always emerge victorious as all its servicepersons and people remain true to the leadership of the Workers' Party of Korea, regarding as treasured sword for sure victory the great idea and faith that have been inherited from the start of the Korean revolution.
					 Rodong Sinmun Friday stresses this in a co-signed article.
					
					 The revolution is for justice and truth, and it advances and triumphs through inheritance of the idea and faith, the article says, adding:
					
					 The first and second generations of the Korean revolution defeated the two formidable imperialisms, going through unheard-of bloody path under the leadership of President Kim Il Sung, because they had no special arms but were strong in ideology and faith.
					
					 The forerunners of the Korean revolution built a country for the people and an invincible socialist power from scratch, only believing in the President and with the Juche-based idea, faith, courage and grit instilled by him.
					
					 With this invariable faith Korean army and people met all challenges and aggression moves of the imperialist allied forces to honorably defend Korean-style socialism and opened a new era of prosperity in the grim period of the "Arduous March," the forced march unprecedented in history.
					
					 The whole course of the Korean revolution was arduous. Especially, in recent years the Korean people had to go through very arduous road of struggle unknown in history. However, they made steady progress, recording the great history of succession and victory. Lurking behind this advance was the immovable idea and faith to go along the road of revolution to the last under the guidance of the great Party.
					
					 The Korean army and people are firmly determined to lead the road of Juche paved by the President invariably to the road of victory in building socialism under the Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il. This strong will has been fully displayed in the course of fresh dynamic advance in the 21st century.
					
					 Last year the historic WPK Conference reelected leader Kim Jong Il to be its general secretary. It was a striking demonstration of the pure and immovable idea and faith of the Korean army and people determined to reliably ensure the centre of unity and leadership of the Korean revolution in the new century, too.
					
					 Now the Korean army and people, who are inching close to the gate of a thriving nation, keenly realize that the road of the Juche revolution, the Songun revolution is the straight one for justice and victory.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Respect to Sovereignty
articles.content:
Amistad China-Corea sera eterna, destaca Wu Donghe
						
 Pyongyang, 15 de julio (ATCC) -- El presidente de la Asociacion de Amistad China-Corea, Wu Donghe, jefe de la delegacion de esta entidad, de visita en Corea, concedio el dia 14 una rueda de prensa con el reportero de la ATCC.
					 Desde el momento de mi llegada a Corea, senti cordialmente el sentimiento de amistad China-Corea, comenzo y prosiguio:
					
					 La amistad China-Corea fue preparada por el Presidente Kim Il Sung, el Presidente Mao Zedong y otros dirigentes de generacion veterana de China.
					
					 Esta amistad deviene el legado y la riqueza preciosos dejados por los dirigentes de generacion vieja de ambos paises.
					
					 Las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion China-Corea, arraigadas en el corazon de los pueblos de dos paises, se desarrollan con vigor en todos los sectores.
					
					 El Secretario General Kim Jong Il visito a China en varias ocasiones, en las cuales compartio con su homologo Hu Jintao opiniones profundas sobre el desarrollo de relaciones bilaterales y otros asuntos de interes comun y llego al acuerdo importante.
					
					 Su visita a China tiene suma importancia para llevar a una nueva etapa mas alta la tradicional amistad China-Corea.
					
					 Se celebro con exito el acto dedicado al 50o aniversario de la concentracion del tratado sobre la amistad, la cooperacion y la ayuda mutua entre China y Corea y se realizan con animacion los viajes mutuos de las delegaciones de alto rango.
					
					 Esto comprueba que ambos paises atribuyen importancia a las relaciones de amistad.
					
					 Durante mi estancia aqui, hice recorrido por varios lugares de Corea y pude ver los aspectos del laborioso pueblo coreano que hace ingentes esfuerzos por acoger significativamente 2012, centenario de nacimiento del Presidente Kim Il Sung.
					
					 Deseo al pueblo coreano el mayor progreso bajo la sabia direccion del Secretario General Kim Jong Il.
					
					 En el futuro contribuiremos a impulsar activamente el desarrollo de relaciones de amistad China-Corea y estrechar el sentimiento de amistad entre los pueblos de ambos paises mediante diversas actividades de cooperacion e intercambio.

articles.title: DPRK Hit by Heavy Rainfalls Again
articles.content:
DPRK Hit by Heavy Rainfalls Again
						
 Pyongyang, July 15 (KCNA) -- Many areas of the DPRK were hit by torrential rainfalls again on Thursday and Friday. 
					 On Thursday it rained 40 mm in Samchon County, South Hwanghae Province from 19:25 to 20:25 and 82 mm in Jaeryong County, 71 mm in Thaethan County, 64 mm in Sinchon County, South Hwanghae Province and 50 mm in Hwangju County, North Hwanghae Province from 18:00 to 21:00.    
					
					 From 21:00 to 24:00, Sungho County of North Hwanghae Province, Sonchon County of North Phyongan Province and Samsok District of Pyongyang had 62 mm, 60 mm and 56 mm rainfalls respectively.
					
					 In particular, there were 58 mm, 67 mm and 54 mm downpours in Pukchang County, South Phyongan Province at three-hour intervals from 21:00 Thursday to 06:00 Friday.
					
					 The torrential rainfalls brought damage to cropland, collieries, mines and other economic establishments in South and North Hwanghae Provinces, Nampho City and other areas. 
					
					 The downpours also did harm to transport. 
					
					 A survey of the damage is now under way.

articles.title: Military Drill against DPRK Staged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Military Drill against DPRK Staged in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, July 15 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet warmongers let cadets of the naval military academy to stage a provocative DPRK-targeted attack drill on Paekryong Island on July 11, the south Korean Yonhap News reported.
					 The drill included an offensive exercise for a surprise landing on the coast of the DPRK.
					
					 The warmongers keen on launching a war against the DPRK are running wild to realize their ambition of confrontation of systems at any cost.

articles.title: S. Korean Intelligence Service's Suppression of People Demanding Vital Rights Flayed
articles.content:
S. Korean Intelligence Service's Suppression of People Demanding Vital Rights Flayed
 Pyongyang, July 15 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Democratic Labor Party of south Korea in a commentary on July 11 rejected the dishonest attempt of the puppet group to politically suppress those taking part in actions for the settlement of registration fee issue.
					 The commentary recalled that the Intelligence Service on July 9 enforced to search the University Education Research Institute.
					
					 The institute, an organ with a long experience in studying the university registration fee issue, recently published a book accusing the authorities of the unreasonable policy on registration fee, it said.
					
					 The IS labeled the institute an "anti-state organization" with no evidence. This is aimed at leading the actions for the settlement of registration fee issue to a political issue, it held.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak Denounced by Organization of Overseas Koreans
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak Denounced by Organization of Overseas Koreans
 Pyongyang, July 15 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Federation of Koreans in the United States issued a commentary on July 11 denouncing the south Korean Lee Myung Bak group of traitors for suppressing the reunification movement.
					 It accused the south Korean security forces of resorting to  wholesale fascist suppression of the reunification movement organizations and patriots by charging them with underground party organization activities, espionage, etc. though they have conducted actions for the independent and peaceful reunification of the country.
					
					 The south Korean Intelligence Service on July 9 cracked down on a room chief of the University Education Research Institute on the strength of the "National Security Law" by labeling him member of the underground party organization and claiming that he struggled for the settlement for registration fee issue at the "instruction of the north", it noted.
					
					 Lee is a traitor to the nation and an obstacle to reunification because no sooner had he come to power than trampled down the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration and cracked down on the reunification movement organizations and personages while pursuing such anti-reunification confrontation policy as "no nukes, opening and 3000 dollars."
					
					 Meanwhile, Minjok Thongsin, an Internet paper of Koreans in the U.S., on the same day posted an article by its editor accusing the Lee group of traitors of the above-said policy.

articles.title: S. Korean Newspapers on Violence Rampant in Puppet Army
articles.content:
S. Korean Newspapers on Violence Rampant in Puppet Army
 Pyongyang, July 15 (KCNA) -- South Korean papers carried editorials on July 9 in connection with a recent incident in which a soldier of the puppet marine corps shot his superiors and colleagues to death. 
					 Kukmin Ilbo said the recent incident fully revealed that violence and harsh treatment are deeply rooted in the army.
					
					 It was disclosed that at least 940 soldiers of the marine corps required hospital treatment due to illness caused by beating and other violence in a matter of a little over two years. This goes to prove that beating is common phenomenon in the army.
					
					 Such practice of a superior as spraying inflammable to a uniform of his inferior to set fire to it and desecrating his religious belief, etc., are barbarous acts, it charged.
					
					 What is more problematic is that the upper echelon of the army is playing down and concealing the above-said facts and feigning ignorance of them, though it is informed of them. On this occasion those responsible for gun-related crimes should be held wholly accountable for them.
					
					 Hangyore said those who committed gun-related crimes this time are the victims of the barracks life torn with violence. The number of suicides is on the steady increase due to violence rife in the army, it noted.

articles.title: S. Korean Police Suppression Slammed
articles.content:
S. Korean Police Suppression Slammed
 Pyongyang, July 15 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Federation of Trade Unions in a statement on July 10 denounced the police for its suppression of the participants in the actions for vital rights.
					 Intolerable is the police violent suppression of the participants in the actions against the unreasonable lay-off by the Hanjin Heavy Industries Co. Ltd., the statement said.
					
					 The suppression revealed again the real intention of the Lee Myung Bak regime which pursues the policy for plutocrats while talking about "pro-common people" and "fair society", it noted.
					
					 The Lee regime is seriously mistaken if it thinks it can calm down the people's resentment with tear liquid and water cannon, it held.

articles.title: Hu Jintao Calls for Keeping Correct Political Orientation of People's Armed Police Force
articles.content:
Hu Jintao Calls for Keeping Correct Political Orientation of People's Armed Police Force
 Beijing, July 14 (KCNA) -- Hu Jintao, chairman of the Central Military Commission of China, speaking before the participants in the second party conference of the People's Armed Police Force on July 11, stressed the need to maintain its correct political orientation.
					 The Force has the duty to protect the security of the country and the stability of society and provide the people with a stable life, he said, underlining the need to attach greater importance to building the Force politically and ideologically sound.
					
					 He called upon the Force to take hold on the military training, put the party-building on a higher scientific basis and thus greatly contribute to building a comprehensively well-off society.

articles.title: Natural Sanctuaries under Creation in Qinghai Province, China
articles.content:
Natural Sanctuaries under Creation in Qinghai Province, China
						
 Beijing, July 14 (KCNA) -- Qinghai Province, China is directing efforts to building natural sanctuaries to improve ecological environment.
					11 natural sanctuaries have been built in the province. They cover 21,805,400 hectares, which account for 30.39 percent of the areas of the province.
					
					 More wild animals and plants are finding home there.

articles.title: Indian PM Calls for Greater Efforts to Fight Terror in South Asia
articles.content:
Indian PM Calls for Greater Efforts to Fight Terror in South Asia
 New Delhi, July 14 (KCNA) -- Indian Prime Minister Manmohan Singh, speaking at an international meeting on July 9, called for greater efforts to combat terrorism in South Asia.
					 Terrorism is a cancer that, if not checked, will consume us all, he said.
					
					 Singh stressed that regional countries should solve their problems themselves.

articles.title: Minju Joson Accuses Hyon In Thaek of Supervising Publication of Anti-reunification Textbooks
articles.content:
Minju Joson Accuses Hyon In Thaek of Supervising Publication of Anti-reunification Textbooks
						
Pyongyang, July 15 (KCNA) -- The puppet ministry of unification of south Korea is busy distributing new textbooks produced under the signboard of "unification education".
					Minju Joson Friday observes in a bylined commentary in this regard:
					
					These textbooks totally deleted such expressions as "dialogue and cooperation" and "partnership" but filled them with such sheer sophism as "southward invasion" and "provocations from the north" in a bid to malignantly hurt even the system of the DPRK and the dignity of its leadership and openly call for achieving "unification under liberal democracy." 
					
					The ministry's production of such textbooks is another grave provocation to the DPRK and an undisguised mockery and insult to all Koreans aspiring after improved inter-Korean relations and the independent reunification of the country. 
					
					What should not be overlooked is that Hyon supervised the fabrication of such textbooks. 
					
					He is the despicable human scum. When he was a professor, he came under intensive fire by media for plagiarizing other's paper before making it public as his own. Despite his poor knowledge Hyon 
					
					amended textbooks as he pleased, keeping them for several months under the pretext of "examination". 
					
					As a matter of fact, it was Hyon who has been engrossed in such acts of treachery as bedeviling the inter-Korean relations and bringing the situation to the brink of war since he took office as the minister.
					
					In recent days he has been busy letting loose a whole string of outbursts pulling up the army and people of the DPRK that have demanded an apology for the hideous provocative acts of hurting the dignity of its leadership and punishment of their main culprits. In this way he has steadily deteriorated the inter-Korean relations. 
					
					Hyon's frantic moves to escalate the confrontation with compatriots might have pleased traitor Lee Myung Bak. But for these deeds he will only face a severe punishment by all Koreans, warns the commentary.

articles.title: S. Korean Group of Traitors' "White Paper on Human Rights of North" under Fire
articles.content:
S. Korean Group of Traitors' "White Paper on Human Rights of North" under Fire
						
 Pyongyang, July 15 (KCNA) -- The Secretariat of the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea Friday issued information bulletin no. 975.
					 The information bulletin said:
					
					 The south Korean puppet group of traitors is distributing the so-called "2011 white paper on human rights of north" malignantly slandering and insulting the socialist system centered on the popular masses in the DPRK and the independent and genuine life of its people.
					
					 The white paper in which they claimed "comprehensively surveyed the human rights situation in the north" is nothing but a dirty document against the DPRK as it is peppered with all sorts of lies, deception, fabrication and mud-slinging and a profound confusing of right and wrong. This is lashing the people of the DPRK into towering resentment as it is a politically-motivated unpardonable provocation against the inviolable system and dignity of the DPRK.
					
					 The issue of the above-said white paper goes to clearly prove once again what extent the group of traitors' hysteria for confrontation with fellow countrymen has reached.
					
					 The Lee Myung Bak group is steeped in such extreme hostility and confrontation with fellow countrymen that it is running wild, bereft of elementary reason and discretion.
					
					 It is disgusting, indeed, for the fascist group to dare utter this or that about someone's "human rights situation" though it has turned south Korea into an unheard-of hell on earth and a graveyard of human rights.
					
					 The people's livelihood has been driven into destitution, justice, truth and human rights are ruthlessly violated and pro-reunification patriots are subject to evermore harsh suppression and persecution in south Korea due to the fascist unpopular rule of the group of traitors.
					
					 Worse still, alarming frauds and swindles, irregularities and corruption are rampant among the puppet ruling quarters including Chongwadae. Politics and the whole society have become so corrupt that people are driven into the abyss of death, deprived of the elementary rights to existence, learning and work. Consequently, the number of suicides is on the steady increase. 
					
					 Hence, south Korea has become the target of curse and criticism after being branded as "a backward land in terms of human rights" and "centre of flesh traffic" worldwide.
					
					 That is why south Korean people from all walks of life including workers, peasants and students are resolutely turning out in the struggle against the group of traitors, chanting "We will no longer live" and "Down with the Lee Myung Bak regime."
					
					 The puppet group is making desperate efforts to tarnish the international image of the DPRK winning victory after victory and calm down the people from all walks of life in south Korea calling for improved inter-Korean relations through the conspiratorial human rights racket. But nothing is more foolish and ridiculous than this.
					
					 The desperate moves of the puppet group to escalate the confrontation with the DPRK would only bring into bolder relief the base and despicable colors as traitors serving outside forces, forsaken by the nation.
					
					 As already declared, the DPRK will never pardon the Lee Myung Bak group hurting the inviolable and dignified system in the DPRK but sternly punish it.
					
					 The group would be well advised to properly understand the burning hatred of the army and people of the DPRK and their will to wage a sacred retaliatory war against it and stop its rash acts.

articles.title: Japan Seeks Overseas Expansion
articles.content:
Japan Seeks Overseas Expansion
 Pyongyang, July 15 (KCNA) -- The authorities of Japan are working hard to realize its ambition for overseas expansion.
					 The Japanese government on July 8 decided to extend by one year the Maritime Self-Defense Forces' antipiracy mission off Somalia, due to end July 23.
					
					 Japan has reportedly maintained two destroyers for escorting, two P-3C patrol planes and about 580 troops in waters off Somalia.

articles.title: Li Yuanchao Calls for Raising Scientific Level of Organizational Work
articles.content:
Li Yuanchao Calls for Raising Scientific Level of Organizational Work 
						
 Beijing, July 14 (KCNA) -- Li Yuanchao, member of the Political Bureau, member of the Secretariat and head of the Organizational Department of the C.C., the Communist Party of China, called for raising the scientific level of organizational work at a recent short course of heads of the organizational departments across the country held in Beijing.
					 He called upon the organizational departments to take the lead in studying and implementing the spirit of the speech made by General Secretary Hu Jintao on July 1 to provide a solid organizational guarantee for the cause of socialism with Chinese characteristics led by the CPC.

articles.title: Liu Yunshan Calls for Kniting Together Strong Forces
articles.content:
Liu Yunshan Calls for Kniting Together Strong Forces
						
 Beijing, July 14 (KCNA) -- Liu Yunshan, head of the Publicity Department of the C.C., the Communist Party of China, underscored the need to knit together strong forces for promoting the cause of socialism with Chinese characteristics.
					 He said this in a recent short course.
					
					 He stressed need for the field of ideological and cultural publicity to give a comprehensive publicity to the speech made by General Secretary Hu Jintao on July 1 so as to effect a surge in studying and implementing it.

articles.title: Zhou Yongkang Calls for Learning from Zhuang Shihua
articles.content:
Zhou Yongkang Calls for Learning from Zhuang Shihua
 Beijing, July 14 (KCNA) -- Zhou Yongkang, member of the Standing Committee of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the Communist Party of China and secretary of the Central Commission of Politics and Law, had a talk with members of the group for giving a report on Zhuang Shihua's advanced acts at the Great Hall of the People. He called upon all the people to learn from him.
					 He urged broad strata of cadre party members to conduct dynamic activities to learn from Zhuang Shihua in order to dedicate themselves to the cause of the party and serve the popular masses.
					
					 He also called upon the people of each nationality to get united and work hard to consolidate and develop the phase of prosperity and development. The cadres and masses of each nationality and servicepersons of the units in Xinjiang should devote their wisdom and energies to the leaping development and the promotion of the long-term stability of the region, he added.

articles.title: Publicity Activities for Preventing and Reducing Disasters Start in China
articles.content:
Publicity Activities for Preventing and Reducing Disasters Start in China
						
 Beijing, July 14 (KCNA) -- "2011 China Action of Volunteers for Publicity for Preventing and Reducing Weather-related Disasters" was kicked off in Beichuan County, Sichuan Province on July 10.
					 It was co-sponsored by the China Meteorological Administration, the C.C., the Communist Youth League of China and the Chinese Association for Science and Technology.
					
					 The above-said campaign will last for a month.
					
					Teachers and students who major in meteorology and its related subjects of ten universities across the country would proceed to various rural areas, schools, factories, mines, etc. to disseminate scientific and technological knowledge about the above said issues and conduct publicity activities.

articles.title: China's Summer Grain Output Up 2.5 Pct This Year
articles.content:
China's Summer Grain Output Up 2.5 Pct This Year
						
 Beijing, July 14 (KCNA) -- China's summer grain output stood at 126.27 million metric tons this year, up 2.5 percent from last year, the National Bureau of Statistics said Monday.

articles.title: Oil Spill Happens in China
articles.content:
Oil Spill Happens in China
						
 Beijing, July 14 (KCNA) -- An oil leak recently occurred in the "Penglai 19-3" oil field operated by ConocoPhillips China.
					 The leak has reportedly polluted an area of 840 square kilometers around the field as of July 11.
					
					 Every measure is being taken to heal its damage.

articles.title: Russian FM Rejects Isolation Policy toward Iran
articles.content:
Russian FM Rejects Isolation Policy toward Iran 
						
 Moscow, July 14 (KCNA) -- Foreign Minister of Russia Sergei Lavrov in a talk on July 12 expressed his country's stand against the policy of isolation and sanctions toward Iran.
					 He held that all parties concerned should take to dialogue rather than isolation and fresh sanctions.

articles.title: Russian Air Force Stages Long-distance Patrol Flight
articles.content:
Russian Air Force Stages Long-distance Patrol Flight
						
 Moscow, July 14 (KCNA) -- Tu-95MC, strategic bomber of the Long-range Flying Corps of the Russian Air Force, staged patrol flight in the sky above the neutral waters of Norwegian Sea, according to a spokesman for the Air Force on July 13.
					 The bomber took off at the Engels air base in Saratov Region and made flight of about 18 hours while being refueled in the midair from Il-78 tanker plane. Its crewmen improved aviation in the conditions hard to judge direction.

articles.title: Russia's Central Election Committee Rejects Use of Foreign Contributions
articles.content:
Russia's Central Election Committee Rejects Use of Foreign Contributions
						
 Moscow, July 14 (KCNA) -- The chairman of the Russian Central Election Committee, in a recent interview with a TV broadcasting service, asked the political parties of the country not to use foreign contributions for the election fund during the parliamentary election campaign. 
					 Any use of funds from foreign individuals and organizations for electioneering expenditure is prohibited by the law, he said, adding that any party should return such funds immediately or any party which has already used up such funds should be excluded from the election.

articles.title: Volcano Erupts in Indonesia
articles.content:
Volcano Erupts in Indonesia
						
 Pyongyang, July 15 (KCNA) -- A volcano erupted in North Sulawesi Province, Indonesia on July 10.
					 Volcano ashes rose up to more than 500 m.
					
					 The government lifted the warning level to the highest and evacuated inhabitants around the volcano to safe place.

articles.title: Brazil's Campaign against Crimes
articles.content:
Brazil's Campaign against Crimes
						
 Pyongyang, July 15 (KCNA) -- Brazil has staged a disarmament campaign from February as part of measures to prevent crimes. 
					 It has collected 9,160 weapons and 30,900 units of ammunition during the first two months of a national disarmament campaign.
					
					 The campaign will last till the end of this year.

articles.title: Pakistan Rejects U.S. threat
articles.content:
Russia's Central Election Committee Rejects Use of Foreign Contributions
 Moscow, July 14 (KCNA) -- The chairman of the Russian Central Election Committee, in a recent interview with a TV broadcasting service, asked the political parties of the country not to use foreign contributions for the election fund during the parliamentary election campaign. 
					 Any use of funds from foreign individuals and organizations for electioneering expenditure is prohibited by the law, he said, adding that any party should return such funds immediately or any party which has already used up such funds should be excluded from the election.

articles.title: Former Pakistani Army Chief Urges Withdrawal of U.S. Forces
articles.content:
Former Pakistani Army Chief Urges Withdrawal of US Forces
						
 Pyongyang, July 15 (KCNA) -- Former Pakistani Army Chief Mirza Aslam Beg recently stated that the U.S. has no other option but to vacate Shamsi Air Base in Balochistan of Pakistan, an airport which was given to American forces for use after the September 11 incident.
					 In an interview with a news agency he added that the Pakistani army with the support of the people would eliminate the menace of terrorism from the country.

articles.title: More U.S. Drone Strikes in Pakistan
articles.content:
More US Drone Strikes in Pakistan
 Pyongyang, July 15 (KCNA) -- The U.S. forces in Afghanistan are continuing drone strikes against Pakistan under the pretext of "anti-terrorism".
					 At least nine people were killed and several others injured in a US drone strike launched Monday night in Pakistan's Miranshah area of North Waziristan.

articles.title: Cooperation among Latin American Countries
articles.content:
Cooperation among Latin American Countries
						
 Pyongyang, July 15 (KCNA) -- The Chilean and Mexican presidents agreed to strengthen bilateral cooperation in agriculture on July 8.
					 Cuba and Bolivia agreed to develop bilateral cooperation in military affairs on the same day.

articles.title: Earthquakes Hit Tonga, Japan
articles.content:
Earthquakes Hit Tonga, Japan
 Pyongyang, July 15 (KCNA) -- An earthquake measuring 5.7 on the Richter scale jolted Tonga region on Monday.
					 The epicenter was waters off the southeast area.
					
					 A 5-magnitude quake hit Iwate Prefecture, Japan on the same day.
					
					 The epicenter was waters off the prefecture.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam se reune con delegacion china
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam se reune con delegacion china
						
 Pyongyang, 15 de julio (ATCC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, departio el dia 15 en el Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae en un ambiente amistoso con la delegacion de la Asociacion de Amistad del Pueblo Chino con el Extranjero y la Asociacion de Amistad China-Corea presidida por el titular de esta ultima, Wu Donghe.
					 El jefe de la delegacion senalo que varias visitas a China del Secretario General Kim Jong Il tienen suma importancia en desarrollar la tradicional amistad China-Corea a una etapa mas alta.
					
					 Dijo que quedo impresionado profundamente al presenciar los exitos logrados por el laborioso y valiente pueblo coreano en varios sectores.
					
					 Deseo que bajo la direccion del Secretario General Kim Jong Il el pueblo coreano abra las puertas a la gran potencia prospera en 2012, centenario de nacimiento del Presidente Kim Il Sung.
					
					 Expreso su voluntad de contribuir a fortalecer las relaciones de amistad China-Corea conforme a los propositos de los maximos dirigentes de los dos paises.

articles.title: Amistad China-Corea sera eterna, destaca Wu Donghe
articles.content:
Amistad China-Corea sera eterna, destaca Wu Donghe
						
 Pyongyang, 15 de julio (ATCC) -- El presidente de la Asociacion de Amistad China-Corea, Wu Donghe, jefe de la delegacion de esta entidad, de visita en Corea, concedio el dia 14 una rueda de prensa con el reportero de la ATCC.
					 Desde el momento de mi llegada a Corea, senti cordialmente el sentimiento de amistad China-Corea, comenzo y prosiguio:
					
					 La amistad China-Corea fue preparada por el Presidente Kim Il Sung, el Presidente Mao Zedong y otros dirigentes de generacion veterana de China.
					
					 Esta amistad deviene el legado y la riqueza preciosos dejados por los dirigentes de generacion vieja de ambos paises.
					
					 Las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion China-Corea, arraigadas en el corazon de los pueblos de dos paises, se desarrollan con vigor en todos los sectores.
					
					 El Secretario General Kim Jong Il visito a China en varias ocasiones, en las cuales compartio con su homologo Hu Jintao opiniones profundas sobre el desarrollo de relaciones bilaterales y otros asuntos de interes comun y llego al acuerdo importante.
					
					 Su visita a China tiene suma importancia para llevar a una nueva etapa mas alta la tradicional amistad China-Corea.
					
					 Se celebro con exito el acto dedicado al 50o aniversario de la concentracion del tratado sobre la amistad, la cooperacion y la ayuda mutua entre China y Corea y se realizan con animacion los viajes mutuos de las delegaciones de alto rango.
					
					 Esto comprueba que ambos paises atribuyen importancia a las relaciones de amistad.
					
					 Durante mi estancia aqui, hice recorrido por varios lugares de Corea y pude ver los aspectos del laborioso pueblo coreano que hace ingentes esfuerzos por acoger significativamente 2012, centenario de nacimiento del Presidente Kim Il Sung.
					
					 Deseo al pueblo coreano el mayor progreso bajo la sabia direccion del Secretario General Kim Jong Il.
					
					 En el futuro contribuiremos a impulsar activamente el desarrollo de relaciones de amistad China-Corea y estrechar el sentimiento de amistad entre los pueblos de ambos paises mediante diversas actividades de cooperacion e intercambio.

articles.title: Cayo lluvia torrencial en Corea
articles.content:
Cayo lluvia torrencial en Corea
						
 Pyongyang, 15 de julio (ATCC) -- La lluvia torrencial caida varios dias en Corea acarreo muchos danos.
					 El dia 14, desde a las 19:25 hasta a las 20:25 cayeron 40 milimetros de lluvia en el distrito de Samchon de la provincia de Hwanghae del Sur; entre  las 18 y las 21 horas 82mm, 71mm y 64mm en los distritos de Jaeryong, Thaethan y Sinchon de la provincia de Hwanghae del Sur, respectivamente, y 50mm en el distrito de Hwangju de la provincia de Hwanghae del Norte; entre las 21 y las 24, 62mm, 60mm y 56mm en el distrito de Sungho de la provincia de Hwanghae del Norte, el distrito de Sonchon de la provincia de Phyong-an del Norte y el municipio de Samsok de la ciudad de Pyongyang, respectivamente.
					
					 Sobre todo, en el distrito de Pukchang de la provincia de Phyong-an del Sur, cayeron 58mm, 67mm y 54mm de lluvia torrencial a intervalo de tres horas desde a las 21 del dia 14 hasta a las 6 del dia 15.
					
					 Ademas, llovio a cantaros en otras localidades coreanas.
					
					 Como resultado, se sumergieron las tierras cultivables de varias localidades, entre otras, la provincia de Hwanghae del Sur y del Norte y la ciudad de Nampho y quedaron damnificados varios sectores de la economia nacional como las minas carboniferas y minerales.
					
					 Tambien, el transporte sufre dificultades.
					
					 Ahora, los organos correspondientes inspeccionan el estado de danos.
